result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle R. Bottolfson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
All probation terms are consecutive to 13CF438 count 1 and 12CF447 count 1.
Concurrent with: Count 3 in 12CF447.

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/costs to be paid through Clerk of Courts Office - 60 days to pay or setup payment plan.
$391.91 restitution plus 10% surcharge ($39.19) for total of $431.10 to be paid through Probation.  Joint and Serveral with Ethan Thomas and Cody Aamold.
Must provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.
May not possess/use firearms or body armor.

May not vote until civil rights are restored.  
Cannot hold elected office.
If not a US citizen may face deportation.  
Potential loss of other citizenship rights.  
No contact with Andrew Lindahl.
$714.79 restitution for Walmart which is to be paid through Probation.  Joint and Serveral with Haley Eason, Jesse Stelton, Christopher Rundquist and Ashley Bottolfson.
